SetupDetails.QuestDesc: Extract all the bears at the Aabe Shifap Ruins along the river.

Operation.Name: Get Total Target Count
Operation.Description: Updates a variable to the number of total target objectives in the sideop.

Choice.Name: Number Variable
Choice.Description: The variable to copy the table count to.

Value.Template: local totalTargets = 0 if mvars.ene_questTargetList then for _, targetInfo in pairs(mvars.ene_questTargetList) do if targetInfo.isTarget == true then totalTargets = totalTargets + 1 end end end if mvars.ani_questTargetList then for _, _ in pairs(mvars.ani_questTargetList) do totalTargets = totalTargets + 1 end end if qvars.ObjectiveTypeList and qvars.ObjectiveTypeList.targetItemList then for _, _ in pairs(qvars.ObjectiveTypeList.targetItemList) do totalTargets = totalTargets + 1 end end return totalTargets

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison
Choice.Description: The comparison function.

Choice.Name: Num1
Choice.Description: The number on the left-hand side of the comparison.

Choice.Name: Num2
Choice.Description: The number on the right-hand side of the comparison.

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison
Choice.Description: The comparison function.

Choice.Name: Num1
Choice.Description: The number on the left-hand side of the comparison.

Choice.Name: Num2
Choice.Description: The number on the right-hand side of the comparison.

Operation.Name: Win
Operation.Description: The player immediately wins the sideop. Operations and scripts in the triggered event will finish executing, but any new events will not trigger sideop scripts.

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison
Choice.Description: The comparison function.

Choice.Name: Num1
Choice.Description: The number on the left-hand side of the comparison.

Choice.Name: Num2
Choice.Description: The number on the right-hand side of the comparison.

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison

Choice.Name: Num1

Operation.Name: Print Sideop Progress Notification
Operation.Description: Prints the Progress Notification associated to the current sideop, given a current tally of the objectives completed and the total count of objectives.
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempCurrentObjectiveCount = |[1|NUMBER]| local tempTotalObjectiveCount = |[2|NUMBER]| local showAnnounceLogId = TppQuest.questCompleteLangIds[ TppQuest.GetCurrentQuestName() ] if showAnnounceLogId then TppUI.ShowAnnounceLog(showAnnounceLogId, tempCurrentObjectiveCount, tempTotalObjectiveCount) end

Choice.Name: Objectives Completed
Choice.Description: The number of objectives that the player has completed thus far.

Choice.Name: Total Objectives
Choice.Description: The total number of objectives in the sideop.

Precondition.Name: Compare Number Values
Precondition.Description: Compares two numbers. - 'qvars.Equals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are the same value. - 'qvars.NotEquals' returns true when Num1 and Num2 are not the same value. - 'qvars.LessThan' returns true when Num1 is less than Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThan' returns true when Num1 is greater than Num2. - 'qvars.LessThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is less than or equal to Num2. - 'qvars.GreaterThanOrEqualTo' returns true when Num1 is greater than or equal to Num2.

Choice.Name: Comparison
Choice.Description: The comparison function.

Choice.Name: Num1
Choice.Description: The number on the left-hand side of the comparison.

Choice.Name: Num2
Choice.Description: The number on the right-hand side of the comparison.

Operation.Name: Lose
Operation.Description: The player immediately loses the sideop. Operations and scripts in the triggered event will finish executing, but any new events will not trigger sideop scripts.

Precondition.Name: Check Hidden Timer
Precondition.Description: Checks whether or not a background timer is ticking.

Choice.Name: Sender
Choice.Description: The name of the timer.

Choice.Name: Is Already Active
Choice.Description: Set to true to check if the timer is running. Set to false to check if the timer is not running.

Operation.Name: Unset Flag
Operation.Description: Unflags an identifier. If the identifier is not flagged yet, this does nothing.

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Print Notification
Operation.Description: Prints up to 5 strings and or numbers as an in-game notification.

Choice.Name: Value 1
Choice.Description: 1st Text that will print to notifications

Value.Value: The water here is cool and refreshing...

Choice.Name: Value 2
Choice.Description: 2nd Text that will print to notifications

Choice.Name: Value 3
Choice.Description: 3rd Text that will print to notifications

Choice.Name: Value 4
Choice.Description: 4th Text that will print to notifications

Choice.Name: Value 5
Choice.Description: 5th Text that will print to notifications

Operation.Name: Start Hidden Timer
Operation.Description: Begins a background countdown that sends a Timer -> "Start" and Timer -> "Finish" event. This can be used for chaining events together on a delay, or creating a delayed event loop. The name of the timer is the sender of the event.

Choice.Name: Sender
Choice.Description: The name of the timer. When the timer is finished, an event will occur. You can catch that event By creating a new script with a "Timer" StrCode, "Finish" message, and this value as the "Sender".

Choice.Name: Duration (Seconds)
Choice.Description: The number of seconds that the timer will count to before triggering the "Finish" event.

Operation.Name: Set Flag
Operation.Description: Flags an identifier. If the identifier is already flagged, this does nothing.

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Unset Flag
Operation.Description: Unflags an identifier. If the identifier is not flagged yet, this does nothing.

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Precondition.Name: Check Flag
Precondition.Description: Checks whether a string identifier has been flagged or not.
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: local tempFlagCheck = qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] if |[2|BOOLEAN]| then return tempFlagCheck == true else return tempFlagCheck == nil end

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Choice.Name: Is Set
Choice.Description: Set to true to check if the identifier has already been flagged. Set to false to check if the flag identifier has not been set yet.

Precondition.Name: True Only Once Flag
Precondition.Description: Combines the Check Flag precondition with a Set Flag operation on the same identifier. Checks whether a string identifier has been flagged. If not, this precondition will return true AND flag the identifier. Thus, this precondition will only be fulfilled once, unless the flag is manually unset.
Precondition.EventFunctionTemplate: if not qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] then qvars.CommonFlagTable[|[1|STRING,NUMBER]|] = true return true end return false

Choice.Name: Flag Name
Choice.Description: A flag ID value. Any string or number can be used as a flag identifier, even if it is being used for some other purpose, like a UI notification.

Operation.Name: Fade Out To Black
Operation.Description: The screen fades to black, as though a cutscene or a loading screen begins.

Choice.Name: Sender
Choice.Description: When the fade out is completed, a "EndFadeOut" message is sent. This value will be the name of the sender.

Choice.Name: Fade-Out Time (Seconds)
Choice.Description: The amount of time in seconds before the screen is completely faded out.

Operation.Name: Wash Player
Operation.Description: Immediately washes the player. Resets blood, bugs (for 3 in-game days) and soot effects. Logic pulled from my Provisional Showers mod.
Operation.EventFunctionTemplate: Player.SetWetEffect() Player.ResetDirtyEffect() vars.passageSecondsSinceOutMB = 259200 TppUiCommand.AnnounceLogView("Partially Physically and Mentally Refreshed")

Operation.Name: Fade In From Black
Operation.Description: The screen fades back in, as though a cutscene or a loading screen ended.

Choice.Name: Sender
Choice.Description: When the fade in is completed, a "EndFadeIn" message is sent. This value will be the name of the sender.

Choice.Name: Fade-In Time (Seconds)
Choice.Description: The amount of time in seconds before the screen is completely faded back in.
